metadata.title: CVE-2018-5873 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the __ns_get_path function in fs/nsfs.c in theLinux kernel before 4.11. Due to a race condition when accessing files, aUse After Free condition can occur. This also affects all Android releasesfrom CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRDAndroid) before security patch level 2018-07-05.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
